education.summary: Built a foundation in statistical analysis and behavioral data modeling, later transitioning to computer science through rigorous self-directed learning. Understood human cognition and social factors influencing learning, inspiring a shift toward computational solutions that address real-world educational inequities.

work.summary: Spearheaded machine learning research and industrialization for semiconductor design, with a focus on thermal simulation, leakage analysis, and multi-agent AI systems. Bridged academic research with industry by driving innovative machine learning deployment and enabling cross-disciplinary collaboration.
highlights: Developed and deployed physics-aware deep learning models for SoC thermal simulation, reducing maximum temperature prediction error by 34%.
Engineered layout-dependent leakage analysis methodology, enhancing pre-silicon estimation accuracy by 10% across multiple product lines.
Built scalable data analysis and visualization pipelines for IC design, improving decision-making speed and accuracy.
Led automation of RF/analog circuit design using multi-agent LLM systems, driving Pass@1 success rate to over 84% on complex tasks.
Published 3 peer-reviewed papers in top conferences (NeurIPS, IEEE VLSI TSA, IEEE ICLAD) as first/co-author.
Established industry-academia partnerships and secured research sponsorships, supporting talent development and knowledge exchange.
Mentored junior engineers and interns, fostering open collaboration and a culture of continuous learning.

work.summary: Conducted quantitative UX research, developed statistical models and empirical methods to extract actionable insights from large-scale user data, and worked with cross-functional teams to improve user experience.
highlights: Defined and quantified UX goals across multiple product areas with engineers and data scientists.
Developed statistical models for behavioral pattern analysis on large datasets.
Applied empirical methods (ANOVA, Chi-Squared, T-tests) for hypothesis testing and data validation.
Communicated findings to diverse stakeholders, driving product improvements.

publications.name: MenTeR: A fully-automated Multi-agenT workflow for end-to-end RF/Analog Circuits Netlist Design
publications.publisher: IEEE International Conference on LLM-Aided Design (ICLAD)
publications.summary: Proposed a scalable, fully-automated multi-agent workflow for RF/Analog circuit netlist design, integrating Diagram-Aware Retrieval-Augmented Generation and Chain-of-Stage reasoning. Achieved state-of-the-art results on real-world analog circuit design tasks, validating the potential of AI-assisted EDA systems.

publications.name: A Leakage Analysis Methodology Considering Intra-Cell and Inter-Cell Layout Dependent Effects
publications.summary: Co-authored a novel methodology for digital logic IP-level leakage analysis, incorporating both intra-cell and inter-cell layout-dependent effects. Improved pre-silicon and post-silicon correlation by over 10% in industrial mixed-Vt designs.

publications.name: Fast SoC Thermal Simulation with Physics-aware U-Net
publications.summary: Co-authored a physics-aware U-Net model for rapid SoC thermal simulation, embedding Fourier-Biot constraints in the loss function. Reduced maximum temperature error by 34% and achieved >100x speedup over commercial CFD tools.

projects.name: MenTeR: Multi-Agent Analog Circuit Design System
projects.description: Led engineering and system integration for MenTeR, an end-to-end automated workflow for RF/analog circuit netlist design based on LLM agents. Focused on cross-agent collaboration, reusable knowledge base construction, and seamless integration with industrial flows.
highlights: Architected and engineered PI, Circuit, and Testbench agents for automation of specification analysis, netlist generation, and simulation validation.
Built the Circuit Think Tank, a reusable domain knowledge base for design pattern acceleration.
Significantly reduced manual workload and boosted design success rates on real-world analog circuits.
Drove practical adoption through industry-academia collaboration.

projects.name: AI Thermal Simulation Platform
projects.description: Core developer for a physics-aware, data-efficient SoC thermal simulation engine. Focused on model architecture, loss function design, data pipeline optimization, and experimental validation.
highlights: Integrated thermal gradient and laplacian constraints, improving data efficiency and model fidelity.
Benchmarked system against commercial CFD tools, achieving 34% MTE reduction and 100x speedup.
Explored and prototyped transformer-based variants for future research directions.

projects.name: Leakage Analysis Automation
projects.description: Developed scalable toolchains and visualization dashboards for automated semiconductor leakage analysis, enabling efficient cross-team data-driven validation and model refinement.
highlights: Automated extraction and modeling of layout-dependent leakage effects, deployed across multiple product lines.
Enabled real-time silicon measurement analysis for rapid debugging and yield improvement.

projects.name: Open Source & Research Collaboration
projects.description: Advanced engineering productivity and research integration through open-source contributions and academic partnerships.
highlights: Contributed to major ML and LLM open-source projects (AutoGen, LangChain, Langraph, MLflow), resolving critical bugs and improving framework reliability.
Initiated technical collaborations with leading researchers (e.g., DeepMind, Penn State) and facilitated knowledge sharing with external partners.
Improved internal workflow efficiency through DevOps pipeline optimization and technical mentoring.
